results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Archives and Records;Search and Seizure;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Justice Department;National Archives and Records Administration;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Trump Organization;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla)
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Jodi Kantor, Adam Goldman and Ben Protess
results.title: Trump Had More Than 300 Classified Documents at Mar-a-Lago
results.abstract: The National Archives found more than 150 sensitive documents when it got a first batch of material from the former president in January, helping to explain the Justice Department’s urgent response.

media.caption: National Archives officials spent much of 2021 trying to recover material from former President Donald J. Trump that he should have turned over when he left office.
media.copyright: Saul Martinez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Face;Genetics and Heredity;DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid);Twins;Facial Recognition Software;Photography;Microbiology;Forensic Science;Research;your-feed-science;Brunelle, Francois;Cell Reports (Journal)
results.byline: By Kate Golembiewski and François Brunelle
results.title: Your Doppelgänger Is Out There and You Probably Share DNA With Them
results.abstract: That person who looks just like you is not your twin, but if scientists compared your genomes, they might find a lot in common.

media.caption: Charlie Chasen and Michael Malone, Atlanta, 2014.

results.adx_keywords: Letters;United States Politics and Government;Classified Information and State Secrets;Executive Privilege, Doctrine of;Trump, Donald J;Wall, Debra Steidel;National Archives and Records Administration;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Justice Department
results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Trump Kept Over 700 Pages of Classified Documents, Letter Says
results.abstract: The letter from the National Archives, which was sent to the former president’s lawyers, described Justice Department officials’ alarm as they realized the nature of the documents at Mar-a-Lago.

media.copyright: Emil Lippe for The New York Times

results.title: Biden to Announce Decision on Student Debt, Affecting Millions of Borrowers
results.abstract: The decision, expected Wednesday, will cap months of deliberations over fairness and the potential to exacerbate an inflation rate that has reached a 40-year high.

media.caption: Activists have escalated pressure in recent months on President Biden to cancel student debt.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.title: Two Men Convicted in Plot to Kidnap Michigan’s Governor
results.abstract: The trial came months after a different federal jury did not return any convictions in the case, one of the country’s highest-profile domestic terror prosecutions.

media.caption: Prosecutors told jurors that the men were upset about Covid-19 restrictions and that they plotted a kidnapping raid on Gov. Gretchen Whitmer’s vacation home.
media.copyright: Emily Elconin for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Hair;Baldness;Rogaine (Drug);Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Doctors;Medicine and Health;Generic Brands and Products
results.title: An Old Medicine Grows New Hair for Pennies a Day, Doctors Say
results.abstract: Dermatologists who specialize in hair loss say that the key ingredient in a topical treatment worked even better when taken orally at a low dose.

media.caption: Brandy Gray, 44, was seen by Dr. Crystal Aguh before and after treatment with oral minoxidil.
media.copyright: Crystal Aguh/Johns Hopkins School of Medicine

results.byline: By Eduardo Medina and Remy Tumin
results.title: An Unidentified Illness Is Killing Dogs in Michigan, Officials Say
results.abstract: Veterinarians are not sure how contagious the malady is. Most of the dogs affected so far have been under the age of two, an official said.

media.caption: Smokey, a 10-month-old silver Labrador retriever, experienced symptoms that left him lethargic. Officials believe a strain of parvovirus could be to blame for an illness affecting dogs in Michigan.

results.title: Ex-Detective Admits Misleading Judge Who Approved Breonna Taylor Raid
results.abstract: Kelly Goodlett, the former detective, pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy. She is the first officer to be convicted in the fatal police operation.

media.caption: A memorial to Breonna Taylor in Louisville, Ky.

results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Glenn Thrush and Alan Feuer
results.title: Trump, Without the Presidency’s Protections, Struggles for a Strategy
results.abstract: Facing serious legal peril in the documents investigation, the former president has turned to his old playbook of painting himself as persecuted amid legal and political stumbles.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump is going into battle in the documents investigation without the experienced lawyers who were at his disposal when he was in the White House.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

results.title: Student Fatally Shot by Woman He Stopped to Help

results.title: Dogs Attack and Kill Mail Carrier in Florida, Officials Say
results.abstract: Pamela Jane Rock had been out delivering mail when her vehicle broke down in Putnam County, Fla. Then, five dogs attacked her, the authorities said.

media.caption: The Putnam County Sheriff’s Office provided this picture of the dogs.

results.title: May I Cut My Daughter Out of My Life?
results.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on whether a parent can cut off contact with a difficult child, when a parent can break a child’s confidence and more.

results.abstract: A pair of afternoon shootings by the woman, who was later arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, were not random, the police said.
